Psychology_tweet_91_r.News Finding: Learning a lot about sleep from @username. Naps and sleep are very important for young children to enhance emotional memory. Even more reasons for a daytime siesta.
Psychology_tweet_91_r.Paper Finding: Notably, here too with emotional memories, we found a significant association between ΔRecall nap and ΔRecall overnight such that declines in accuracy across the nap were associated with improvements across overnight sleep (B = −0.488, p = 0.029; 95% CI: [−1.294, −0.079]; Fig.
Psychology_tweet_91_r.News Context: Learning a lot about sleep from @username. Naps and sleep are very important for young children to enhance emotional memory. Even more reasons for a daytime siesta.
Psychology_tweet_91_r.Paper Context: In that study, ΔRecall nap predicted ΔRecall overnight , suggesting an interaction of multiple sleep bouts on memory processing. Notably, here too with emotional memories, we found a significant association between ΔRecall nap and ΔRecall overnight such that declines in accuracy across the nap were associated with improvements across overnight sleep (B = −0.488, p = 0.029; 95% CI: [−1.294, −0.079]; Fig. We did not receive caregiver reports for 9 of the children.

Psychology_263_r.News Finding: The result was that all participants rated the four odours more positively when they were presented with positive labels than when presented with negative labels.
Psychology_263_r.Paper Finding: Although labels appear to also influence intensity ratings and reaction times, this seems to be a more complex relationship that could be modulated by additional factors such as odor valence, label fit, and possibly the edibility attributed to an odor or a label.
Psychology_263_r.News Context: When associated with a pleasant label, we enjoy the odour more than when it is presented with a negative label. The result was that all participants rated the four odours more positively when they were presented with positive labels than when presented with negative labels. Specifically, participants described the odours as pleasant and edible (even those associated with non-food items) when associated with positive labels.
Psychology_263_r.Paper Context: In summary, odor labels affect pleasantness ratings and edibility perception. Although labels appear to also influence intensity ratings and reaction times, this seems to be a more complex relationship that could be modulated by additional factors such as odor valence, label fit, and possibly the edibility attributed to an odor or a label. Odors with different valences impact our mood and wellbeing in different ways.
Psychology_263_r.text: ['Finding: The result was that all participants rated the four odours more positively when they were presented with positive labels than when presented with negative labels.']
Psychology_263_r.displayed_text: Finding: The result was that all participants rated the four odours more positively when they were presented with positive labels than when presented with negative labels.

Psychology_tweet_13_r.News Finding: Music training can enhance teenage brain development, study suggests
Psychology_tweet_13_r.Paper Finding: Our results support the notion that the adolescent brain remains receptive to training, underscoring the importance of enrichment during teenage years.
Psychology_tweet_13_r.News Context: Music training can enhance teenage brain development, study suggests
Psychology_tweet_13_r.Paper Context: These changes seem to benefit literacy skills: both groups improved in phonological awareness relative to the general population, but the music training group improved more compared with the active controls. Our results support the notion that the adolescent brain remains receptive to training, underscoring the importance of enrichment during teenage years. Both types of training required investment of time and effort and emphasized the development of self-discipline, dedication, and determination; however, only the music training targeted auditory function.
Psychology_tweet_13_r.text: ['Finding: Music training can enhance teenage brain development, study suggests ']
Psychology_tweet_13_r.displayed_text: Finding: Music training can enhance teenage brain development, study suggests

Psychology_594_r.News Finding: Hungry shoppers bought more high-calorie foods, many of which were processed snacks and candy.
Psychology_594_r.Paper Finding: Finally, the positive influence of the hunger manipulation on acquisition held after including mood as a covariate [F(1, 58) = 6.61, P < 0.02].
Psychology_594_r.News Context: There was, however, a difference in the quality of the foods added to their carts. Hungry shoppers bought more high-calorie foods, many of which were processed snacks and candy. Satiated shoppers tended towards lower-calorie foods such as fruits and fresh vegetables.
Psychology_594_r.Paper Context: Mood did not influence the acquisition of binder clips (b = -0.048, SE = 0.208, t = -0.23, P > 0.80) or their evaluation (b = 0.058, SE = 0.119, t = 0.49, P > 0.60). Finally, the positive influence of the hunger manipulation on acquisition held after including mood as a covariate [F(1, 58) = 6.61, P < 0.02]. It also had a very small collection of snacks.
Psychology_594_r.text: ['Finding: Hungry shoppers bought more high-calorie foods, many of which were processed snacks and candy.']
Psychology_594_r.displayed_text: Finding: Hungry shoppers bought more high-calorie foods, many of which were processed snacks and candy.

Psychology_tweet_185_r.News Finding: 'Upstream Color' in a neuro tweet? LIP neurons exhibit integrative representations of both color & motion features
Psychology_tweet_185_r.Paper Finding: We focused on neurons that were both color and direction selective using the three-way ANOVA or showed significant color and direction tuning shifts (n = 71) during the DCM task (using different populations led to similar results).
Psychology_tweet_185_r.News Context: 'Upstream Color' in a neuro tweet? LIP neurons exhibit integrative representations of both color & motion features
Psychology_tweet_185_r.Paper Context: This raises a question about whether feature encoding in LIP is used to detect and respond to match stimuli. We focused on neurons that were both color and direction selective using the three-way ANOVA or showed significant color and direction tuning shifts (n = 71) during the DCM task (using different populations led to similar results). Responses to match stimuli ( Figure S2A ) were higher than for nonmatch stimuli for both sample A (paired t test, p = 4 3 10 À5 ) and B (p = 0.001) trials.
Psychology_tweet_185_r.text: ['Finding: \'Upstream Color\' in a neuro tweet? LIP neurons exhibit integrative representations of both color & motion features ']
Psychology_tweet_185_r.displayed_text: Finding: 'Upstream Color' in a neuro tweet? LIP neurons exhibit integrative representations of both color & motion features

Psychology_30_r.News Finding: The study's findings showed that, regardless of cultural background, circumcised boys may run a greater risk of developing ASD.
Psychology_30_r.Paper Finding: The increased risk of ASD in circumcised boys under the age of 5 years was present among boys in both Muslim and non-Muslim families ( Table 2) .
Psychology_30_r.News Context: The researchers, who followed the boys up to the age of nine, found that almost 5,000 cases of ASD were diagnosed. The study's findings showed that, regardless of cultural background, circumcised boys may run a greater risk of developing ASD. The researchers noted they also made an unexpected observation of an increased risk of hyperactivity disorder among circumcised boys in non-Muslim families.
Psychology_30_r.Paper Context: The HR was higher, though not significantly so, for boys circumcised at age 24 months or older (HR ¼ 1.96; 95% CI: 0.93-4.14), an estimate based on only seven cases of ASD in that group ( Table 2) . The increased risk of ASD in circumcised boys under the age of 5 years was present among boys in both Muslim and non-Muslim families ( Table 2) . Risk in this age group was markedly elevated among boys in non-Muslim families (HR ¼ 4.23; 95% CI: 1.90-9.44), a finding based on six ASD cases in circumcised boys versus 1165 cases in intact boys.
Psychology_30_r.text: ['Finding: The study\'s findings showed that, regardless of cultural background, circumcised boys may run a greater risk of developing ASD.']
Psychology_30_r.displayed_text: Finding: The study's findings showed that, regardless of cultural background, circumcised boys may run a greater risk of developing ASD.

Psychology_4_r.News Finding: In all three cities, the researchers identified new cases of autism in mainstream schools, confirming that there is under-diagnosis of autism in China.
Psychology_4_r.Paper Finding: Third, in all three cities, new cases of autism were identified by the study in mainstream schools, reflecting current under-diagnosis.
Psychology_4_r.News Context: In Shenzhen and Jiamusi cities, only data for children in mainstream education was available; in Shenzhen City, 42 out of every 10,000 children in mainstream education had autism, and in Jiamusi City this figure was 19 per 10,000. In all three cities, the researchers identified new cases of autism in mainstream schools, confirming that there is under-diagnosis of autism in China. "Contrary to previous studies, we have shown that the prevalence of autism spectrum conditions in China is in line with that found in the West," said Dr Sophia Xiang Sun, who conducted this study as part of her PhD at Cambridge University and who is now based in the Star Kay Bridge Research Centre for Children with Autism in Xiamen, China.
Psychology_4_r.Paper Context: Second, in Shenzhen and Jiamusi cities, where only mainstream data were available, prevalence is also in line with Western estimates . Third, in all three cities, new cases of autism were identified by the study in mainstream schools, reflecting current under-diagnosis. Finally, non-significant variation across different cities is seen indicating the need to explore potential variation of autism across diverse Chinese regions with large sample sizes to achieve a fully robust national picture.
Psychology_4_r.text: ['Finding: In all three cities, the researchers identified new cases of autism in mainstream schools, confirming that there is under-diagnosis of autism in China.']
Psychology_4_r.displayed_text: Finding: In all three cities, the researchers identified new cases of autism in mainstream schools, confirming that there is under-diagnosis of autism in China.
